website_summaries.verdict: The Pentax K-70 is an affordable SLR with the benefit of weather sealing, but like most of its competitors, its Live View focus system is underwhelming.
pros: In-body image stabilization.Pixel Shift Resolution and AA Simulation options
cons: Burst shooting rate doesn't match up to specs

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: BIG upgrade from my previous K-110D, so far I'm very impressed, compact, light, very natural to hold. The WiFi link to mobile works perfectly. Only put a few images through it so far and haven't scratched the surface of the features and customisation, but very impressed. I don't think there's a better camera in this price range.

customer_reviews.text: It takes good photos but, for most purposes a mobile phone image is good enough, so carrying around such a bulky item is hard to justify. As a result, it seldom gets used.

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera
customer_reviews.text: Not used all the features yet but I am happy with the picture quality, had no problems with the auto focus, it seems to pick up on what I would want it to and fast enough for my needs. Screen works fine.

customer_reviews.title: Photography at its best using the real gear!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my daughter, who is a keen traveller and wishes to use a 'real' camera for all her destinations. Suffice to say she was very pleased since it was a special birthday!
customer_reviews.author: Brianski

customer_reviews.title: Well priced camera with features normally found in cameras that cost much more
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the Pentax KX, and it was quite a jump in quality. The screen is a real stand out as it is articulated, something I didn't think I needed, also the resolution is much better. I bought the body on its own, and threw on some of my old lenses, now I have ordered a Pentax 16-85mm lens to match the waterproofing of the K-70. It is really great value for money, especially if you are into landscape photography.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M.

customer_reviews.title: Quick and efficient delivery.

customer_reviews.author: Razvan B

customer_reviews.title: ... K-70 is in my opinion at least twice as good. The K-70 is based on the older model ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the K-70 after first buying the Pentax DSLR K-S2 the K-70 is in my opinion at least twice as good. The K-70 is based on the older model and has the weatherproofing and a slightly better stabilisation system plus new pixel-shift. I have found focusing better with the K-70 plus the Wi-Fi helps plus the swing-out monitor and red glow monitor for keeping night-sight when using in low-light conditions. I am currently saving for a second K-70 and will trade in my K-S2
customer_reviews.author: PAJ BEARD

customer_reviews.title: but good camera. Smaller battery than K3 so less shots
customer_reviews.text: Not quite up to K3 standard, but good camera. Smaller battery than K3 so less shots, but good quality images

customer_reviews.text: Have enjoyed using this so far - auto settings ideal, am sure I will use more as I get more confident with manual settings
customer_reviews.author: S.M.Langham

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. Used Pentax for years before digital and ever since. My photgraphs have appeared in many places around the world, I would not submit the results from this. Maybe it was bad one off the production line... Shutter made a tremendous 'clack', software malfunctioned, difficult to open the screen and images not pin-sharp. Returned to Amazon who gave full refund.
customer_reviews.author: al'Miral

customer_reviews.title: Taking photos or gaining a degree in complications ?
customer_reviews.text: Yes it takes good pictures providing you have a degree and a love of unfathomable complications. I think the manufacturer should attempt to make the camera much more user friendly. Inspiration is killed stone dead by the hours spent attempting to understand the menu . Get a writer to explain much more clearly so that the act of taking a picture can be more easily achieved. This is not my first good camera but it is certainly the most difficult to operate
customer_reviews.author: graeme sims

customer_reviews.title: Backwards compatibility with classic lenses.
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding camera, even at full price. The only cons are that it has classic SLR mirror noise and the pentaprism adds weight. The pros are endless, but highlights are backward compatibility with all k and M42 (with adaptor) mount lenses, massive creative menu, in camera shake reduction, 24Mb s APS-C sensor and a far better than average weather resistant kit lens. Auto results are fine, but the Program AE and other modes allow tweaking of the Jpegs that can make them better than the default settings. Images look great even on a 4K TV. Mine came with the 18-55 kit lens which is great for everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Risteard Mac An Bhearshuiligh

customer_reviews.title: At this price point nothing can come closer.
customer_reviews.text: If AF and video is not what you desire, then this is the best SLR you can buy for under 600 pounds. Picture quality is probably the best when compared to a Nikon or Canon at this price point. Also to note that the body is weather sealed but the grip is slightly bigger than what you would normally expect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Timeless and outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my wift to take pictures of our new born but I seem to be using it a lot more
